meanings.definition: The quality of being mendacious or dishonest.
meanings.sent1: Her constant mendaciousnesses made it hard to trust her.
meanings.sent2: His mendaciousnesses were finally exposed when the truth came out.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show exaggerated the mendaciousnesses of the characters for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The dark shadow of mendaciousnesses loomed over the corrupt politician.
meanings.sent5: The vivid image of mendaciousnesses stained his reputation forever.

meanings.definition: The act of telling lies or being untruthful.
meanings.sent1: The mendaciousnesses of the scam artist were evident in his false promises.
meanings.sent2: Avoiding mendaciousnesses is important in building trustworthy relationships.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the teacher's playful mendaciousnesses during storytime.
meanings.sent4: Her smile masked the mendaciousnesses in her words.
meanings.sent5: The courtroom was filled with the weight of his mendaciousnesses during the trial.
